                     <div data-reactid="323">
                      <div data-reactid="324">
                       Private bright and airy room with separate entrance in a beautifully restored craftsman next to Echo Park Lake . Up on a hill where it's quiet and you can hear the birds. Enjoy the garden from your room and front porch with views of downtown. Angelino Heights is a historical and unique area next to Echo Park, DTLA, fashion district, and Silverlake. It feels like you're on a movie set here. You can walk to Sunset Blvd with tons of great restaurants, boutiques, public transportation and nightlife.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="325">
                       Happy clean private room with two windows that have nice views. You have your own entrance to the house from the backyard. The room has a full bed, hardwood floors, and a ceiling fan.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="326">
                       30 BEST THINGS TO DO guidebook for Los Angeles by AirBnb under 3 miles from listing. https://www.airbnb.com/things-to-do/los-angeles Restaurants/Cafes/Bars #14 Bottega Louie (2.1 miles) #30 Mohawk Bend (1.1 miles) #12 Perch (2 miles) #16 Cafe Stella (2.6 miles) #26 Grand Central Market (1.9 miles) Activities: #5 Staples Center (2.7 miles) #10 Dodger Stadium (.7 miles) #29 Walt Disney Concert Hall (1.4 miles) #11 Griffith Park (4.6 miles)
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="348"><p data-reactid="349">The place was very clean and sooo cute. You will have your own entrance/exit and a backyard to sit,read, and grab a lemon. It's in a good location and ubering from here is never costly. Her father is nice and they are happy to please you. It is a shared bathroom but I rarely knew anyone else was there. She leaves you fruit, water, books etc and the ambiance makes you feel like home. I always went straight to sleep and felt so comfortable. Will definitely come again! </p><span data-reactid="350">Whit</span><span data-reactid="351">2017-03-05T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="352"><p data-reactid="353">I actually live in Echo Park and needed a place to stay while my studio was being renovated. Yas' apartment is 5/7 minutes from downtown LA, in walking distance to Elysian Park and Echo Park Lake, and historic Carroll Avenue. Her home is super clean and quiet, and equipped with all the amenities. The images Yas has shown of the bedroom, accurately portrays the room and is comfy for the busy professional or active wanderlust. The kitchen is also equipped with new and clean appliances. Bathroom and laundry is accessible and convenient. Lastly, Yas is very accommodating, friendly and genuinely wants to make sure you enjoy your stay! </p><span data-reactid="354">Ligeia</span><span data-reactid="355">2017-01-30T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="445">
                     <div data-reactid="446">
                      <div data-reactid="447">
                       Experience our charming private guesthouse surrounded by lush gardens in the Elysian Heights neighborhood of Echo Park. Studio floor plan features full kitchen, bath, deck, outdoor dining area. Walk to nature, hiking trails, local cafes.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="448">
                       This lovely cottage is a private detached guest house set in the serene hills of Echo Park. A well equipped studio floor plan features everything you'll need while visiting Los Angeles. Whether you're in town for business or pleasure, something creative or just looking to unwind and escape, we would be honored to host. Read below for details Included with the cottage... Futon and smart TV let's you unwind and catch up on Netflix. Converts to a full bed for extra sleeping space. Queen bed with plush linens with adjustable mood lighting. Spacious bathroom with huge tub, fresh towels, &amp; complimentary soaps. Outdoor meditation deck provides a tranquil spot to relax the mind Full kitchen with gas stove, refrigerator, sink, dishware &amp; kitchen essentials to make your stay more convenient. Prepare a meal and enjoy it alfresco style with the outdoor cafe table.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="449">
                       It's all about location and Echo park comes in the winner. Minutes to downtown LA and the Arts District. Explore LA with ease in this amazing location. We're across the street from the popular FIX (café), a short walk to Chango (coffee shop), Cookbook (specialty grocer) and Sunset Blvd. You're so close to everything yet it's super relaxed up here. Welcome!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="450">
                       <li data-reactid="451"><p data-reactid="452">Great place to stay in LA! I highly recommend!</p><span data-reactid="453">Steve</span><span data-reactid="454">2016-09-26T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="455"><p data-reactid="456">It was lovely staying in Deborah's cottage. Both Fix and Chango cafè are walking distance and sunset Blvd. only a good stroll away!                        <li data-reactid="459"><p data-reactid="460">The place was very nice to stay at. One word of caution is that the place is located on a fairly steep slope. If you aren't comfortable with driving up slopes, you may have a difficult time with getting there. Other than that, the place was well kept and provided a good privacy. </p><span data-reactid="461">Ryan</span><span data-reactid="462">2016-09-11T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="463"><p data-reactid="464">We really enjoyed staying in this Echo Park detached cottage! Tim, the house manager was so nice and was flexible with our check-in/check-out time. The place is spacious, clean, and comfortable. The outdoor gardens and trees make the backyard feel very serene and peaceful. The location is also great, very convenient to eateries and coffee shops in Echo Park, Silverlake and beyond. We especially enjoyed Cafe Valerie five blocks away.                      <div data-reactid="570">
                      <div data-reactid="571">
                       • Walk Score 92 • Parking (first come, first serve) • Hardwood floors throughout • Queen memory foam bed • 43" HDTV w Netflix, Amazon Prime, + Hulu • Coin-operated washer + dryer • Extremely walkable neighborhood
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="572">
                       Silverlake is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Los Angeles, literally downstairs are, restaurants, bars, coffee shops and funky retail stores and you are a short walk away from cool hidden parks.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="573">
                       Check out Airbnb's guide to my neighborhood: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/los-angeles/silver-lake Check my guidebook for my local recommendations. Forbes Magazine has crowned Silver Lake the best hipster hood in the US. Silver Lake beat out 249 other neighborhoods including The Mission District, Williamsburg, Wicker Park in what we're sure is a thoroughly scientific survey of hipness. The criteria for neighborhoods were walkability, coffee shops per capita, local food truck selection and ratings, the number and frequency of farmers markets, the number of locally-owned bars and restaurants and residents who work in artistic occupations. - - - Here is Forbes Magazine's write up - - - America's Hippest Hipster Neighborhoods Silver Lake, Los Angeles, Ca "Want to roll out of bed and pick up a cup of single-origin java from a coffee shop on your corner? Or grab a gourmet grilled cheese sandwich from a food truck parked down the street? Does a dream weekend include foraging for organic veggies at a farmers market and watching the latest hot indie band play on a small stage through the wee hours of the morning? Then, my hipster friend, Los Angeles’ Silver Lake is the neighborhood for you. Silver Lake takes the top spot on Forbes’ inaugural list of America’s Best Hipster Neighborhoods. Nestled between Echo Park and Los Feliz, the trendy community boasts some of the nation’s most lauded food trucks and farmers markets, a multicultural blend of residents with eclectic professions, and a booming arts scene. Even the buildings exude an avant garde aesthetic a hipster could love: Silver Lake is home to some of the most celebrated modernist architecture in the country, including Richard Neutra’s VDL Research House and John Lautner’s Silvertop."
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="591"><p data-reactid="592">The green machine is a nicely decorated and comfortable apartment in a real hip and artsy neighbourhood. We enjoyed watching netflix after a long and tiring day. We didnt get to meet rebecca but check in and out was no problem and she was available by text. As Los Angeles is so big you better need a car to see more of the city as public transportation is not as good as in other citys. But thats a general issue in LA. The place was a little bit too noisy for my taste at night, because of a main road right in front of the window side. With ear plugs no problem.                     <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="700">
                     <div data-reactid="701">
                      <div data-reactid="702">
                       This serene studio is located directly off Sunset Blvd, with a separate entrance from the rest of the building. Total privacy! Walls and floors just cleaned and painted. Newly furnished. Quiet street but a moment away from all the buzz. On the corner is El Compadre (great Mexican food - flaming margaritas!) and Button Mash (bar/arcade/restaurant - super fun!) as well as Dodger Stadium! Studio is close to: Elysian Park, Silver Lake, Staples Center, Chinatown, Los Feliz, Gryffith Park &amp; more!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="703">
                       Studio is perfect for single guest or a couple! We also have a couch that pulls out into a single bed (great for a small child). The kitchen and small dining area is separate from the bedroom and bathroom. There's a couch, chair and coffee table for lounging and a mirrored table for some light work. The closet is enormous with ample space for your luggage or any extras.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="704">
                       Close to: Dodger Stadium, Griffith Park, Echo Park Lake, Silver Lake, Los Feliz, Glendale, Pasadena, Sunset Blvd, Downtown LA and Hollywood. Echo Park is a hilly Eastside neighborhood with lots of hikes and a fun nightlife. Great food and shopping within walking distance.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="705">

                      <div data-reactid="832">
                       My apartment is in the Silverlake / Echo Park neighborhood, an area known for its creative boutique shops, live music venues, and hip restaurants and bars. The apartment is centrally located, with easy access to the 101 freeway. The place is also very close to Echo Park, Elysian Park, and Dodger Stadium. From here, it's also quite easy to reach Griffith Park Observatory, Barnsdall Art Park, and Downtown LA.

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="946">
                     <div data-reactid="947">
                      <div data-reactid="948">
                       Sunny 2 Bedroom 1 bathroom bungalow. Steps away from Elysian Park. Beautiful private backyard. Easy parking on street. Walking distance to all amenities on Sunset Blvd. Cafes/Restaurants, Organic Grocery Store Lassen's and Pharmacy.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="949">
                       Bright private lofty 2 Bedroom bungalow in Echo Park/ Silver Lake. Great for entertaining and relaxing.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="950">
                       Steps away from Elysian Park in Echo Park. Amazing house to accommodate all your needs. Walking distance to cafes/restaurants/bars on Sunset Blvd.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="951">
                       <li data-reactid="952"><p data-reactid="953">Sophia and John were helpful and easy to reach. The house was lovely. Great books, stunning views, top-notch kitchen, very clean and spacious with lovely light. Highly recommend staying here but be aware that the house is one street away from Dodger Stadium, so plan your routes carefully when there are home games, as traffic can be bumper-to-bumper on Sunset.</p><span data-reactid="954">malerie</span><span data-reactid="955">2016-04-17T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="956"><p data-reactid="957">Sophia was very nice and attentive to details, we arrived late at night but she made arrangements so we could come into the house. She responded promptly to questions and clarifications, very nice host. The neighborhood is super nice and well located.</p><span data-reactid="958">Src</span><span data-reactid="959">2016-11-05T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="960"><p data-reactid="961">My husband and I stayed at this Echo Park bungalow for two weeks this spring. It was spacious, bright and clean. Sophia has furnished the place nicely. But the house is not as nice as it appears in pictures. The oven doesn't work, nor does the dishwasher, the backyard is pretty run down, many windowpanes are held together with tape. All in all this place could be great but it needs some attention.</p><span data-reactid="962">Sarah </span><span data-reactid="963">2016-04-05T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="964"><p data-reactid="965">Sophia was a welcoming host. She was communicative with us leading up to are stay. The house was very clean and presentable and as we were here first guests she was responsive in getting any last minute details taken care of. This is a great little home with a fantastic view and in an up and coming area. There are eateries within walking distance, and there is a midsize back yard. </p><span data-reactid="966">Michael</span><span data-reactid="967">2015-12-28T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="968"><p data-reactid="969">Absolutely perfect. The hosts were super-accommodating, the house is amazing, and the location is great -- just a few steps down the hill from Elysian Park, an easy walk to the bars and coffee shops of Echo Park, and a short drive from DTLA. </p><span data-reactid="970">Andrew</span><span data-reactid="971">2016-04-10T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="972"><p data-reactid="973">Sophia personally greeted our party at the door to give us a tour of the space. She was a warm, affable, and genial host. During our stay, she check-in periodically via text to ensure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. Even for four guests, the bungalow feels spacious, well-apportioned, and clean. Separate from the two comfy bedrooms, there is a large common area where guests can lounge, chat, play board games, etc. Bonus points: Free, all-day street parking is plentiful. I would highly recommend this Airbnb to other guests. </p><span data-reactid="974">Danny</span><span data-reactid="975">2016-07-05T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="976"><p data-reactid="977">This place is my home away from home. So many places on AirBNB feel like someone sub-leased a place, went to Wal-Mart in one day for all the decorations and furniture and expect people to feel comfortable in a bland, generic apartment or house. Well, this place is the exact opposite of that. The key word here is taste, and it can't be bought which is why so many other listings are uninspiring and unnviting. But this house has style, comfort, fun and all the amenities you need to not feel like you're staying in a hotel, but your dream home. </p><span data-reactid="978">Andrew</span><span data-reactid="979">2016-06-27T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="980"><p data-reactid="981">Had a great time at this house and echo Park. Neighbourhood was beautiful and a lot to eat and do in the area. Sophia was a very helpful host and met us on time. She was really enthusiastic about giving info on places to eat. The rooms and living area were clean and wonderfully designed and our rare periods of free time were nicely occupied by Apple TV :) Only drawback was that it got a little cool in the house and the heating for the house wasn't always enough but it was a small problem.</p><span data-reactid="982">Jonathan</span><span data-reactid="983">2016-03-13T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="1080"><p data-reactid="1081">This home is an absolute pleasure to stay in.                        <li data-reactid="1088"><p data-reactid="1089">So good, I didn't want to leave. I've stayed in a lot of airbnb's, this was my best airbnb experience by far. It felt like I was staying in a luxury hotel, with loads more space and home comforts. There's even a makeup area! The whole place is light, uplifting and breezy. The bedroom is huge, with a luxury king sized bed, and a fold out sofa for extra people. The house is in a quiet and peaceful area in Silver Lake, perfect for focusing on work (as I did) or unwinding after a day out and about. Catch Lyft or Uber to get around or hire a car. I chose to use Lyft Line most of the time as it's very affordable and usually doesn't take longer than a solo Lyft ride. Aaron's dad, Garrison, and their assistant, Mary, are really lovely and only moments away, so if you need anything, they are there to help. The place is brand spanking new - I was their first guest in this new property - and everything works a charm.                      <div data-reactid="1298">
                      <div data-reactid="1299">
                       Perfect for individual travelers and couples. To die for interior design w/ attention to every detail! Dodger stadium, Echo Park, Griffith Observatory, DTLA, Sunset Blvd, hikes, best bars, shopping, restaurants, museums LA offers. Houses 2 comfortably, but can sleep up to 4.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1300">
                       This beautiful one bedroom is clean, comfortable, and perfectly located in the heart of Echo Park. Enter the kitchen, equipped with everything you need from pots &amp; pans, to electric mixers, coffee &amp; tea. Off the kitchen is the entertainment room, equipped with a projector, apple TV, and fold out bed. Snuggle up and enjoy your favorite movies or shows while utilizing the conveniently located TV trays for snacks and drinks. The bathroom has a wonderful rainfall shower head and is stocked with shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. In the bedroom you will find a luxurious queen sized bed with a beautiful wrought iron frame. Every inch of the place is sunny and beautifully decorated!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1301">
                       Echo Park is the best neighborhood in LA, but don't take my word for it! LA Weekly: (URL HIDDEN) Time Out: (URL HIDDEN) Thrillist: (URL HIDDEN) Huffington Post: (URL HIDDEN) AirBnB: https://www.airbnb.com/locations/los-angeles/echo-park

                       <li data-reactid="1319"><p data-reactid="1320">This apartment is a quaint little lower level unit under the main house, right above Sunset Blvd...awesome location with lots of cafes and bars within walking distance. Inside was exactly as you see in the photos. Cozy with lots of little flea market finds. Loved the attention to detail in the decor. The movie room/nook is comfy and there's enough space to sleep one person there if needed. The queen sized bed was comfy and the shower had good water pressure. There is no "living room" but the shared patio is inviting and has plenty of seating. It was peaceful and quiet, the guests renting the main house above were not noisy at all. Street parking filled up a bit in the evening but we found a spot just a couple houses down. Would definitely recommend as a base to explore the city and experience the local flavor.                        <li data-reactid="1462"><p data-reactid="1463">Similar to other reviews, Sara's place was located in a not-so-safe feeling area, we woke up one morning to a homeless person sleeping outside on the sidewalk. Others commented on how hot the home is, as there is no AC and this was the case with us, however we already knew this so it was to be expected. What was not expected was that there is only one ceiling fan. It would be helpful for guests if Sara purchased a stand alone fan to put in the bedroom or living room area to help with the heat. Also, there were no kitchen towels to do dishes, no instructions or ability to light the gas stove, no microwave, no broom/dustpan, no bathroom shower mat, kitchen ware was lacking (no strainer, no vegetable peeler, no baking sheets for the oven etc). We stay at air bnb's so that we can cook a few meals when we travel, and this was difficult to do here. Sara could make this place more family friendly if she added a few more simple amenities listed above. The location is easy to get to, and the house was very clean and spacious. Blow dryer, shampoo and coffee/filters was a nice touch. I would stay here again, however not with our children due to the sketchy neighbours.</p><span data-reactid="1464">Ryan</span><span data-reactid="1465">2016-11-08T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                      <div data-reactid="1558">
                       Escape the norm &amp; get away from it all Yurt Style!                       </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1559">
                       Chirping birds, blue skies and the smells of blooming jasmine make yurt glamping like no other. Weather your watching the sunset over Hollywood on the patio or morning yoga inside the energetic circle, the yurt stay will be unforgettable. The yurt is the perfect getaway from reality.. Just a short walk from Sunset Junction. See what "Time Out" magazine has to say! "Our LA city guide to Silver Lake reveals the best ways to enjoy this trendy Eastside 'hood, sometimes referred to as the Williamsburg of LA. Sure, Silver Lake's the butt of many a hipster joke, but we tend to mock what we envy most—and there's much to envy here. Silver Lake is one of LA's most walkable 'hoods, with (almost) everything conveniently located right on Sunset Boulevard. There are enough shops, bars and eateries to keep you consuming for days. The area has also managed to marry the shiny and new (of which there's a lot) with the shabby and old, making the neighborhood feel very, well, real. And it's totally bikeable: A Sunset Boulevard bike lane runs the length of the neighborhood and the sidewalks here have more racks than parking meters. Whether you explore Silver Lake on two wheels or two feet, you'll find the best of what this Eastside nabe has to offer—and meet some friendly folks along the way. Enjoy!" Please be aware the bathroom and shower are private, but OUTDOORS. Also, the bathroom has it's own water heater so there should never be a time where the water runs out - but - Being that the water heater is outdoors, the pilot light may go out at times if the wind is high - this happens very rarely - Please also be aware when you book, that they yurt is located in the back of a residential home. If you plan to arrive in the evening, please be aware that the path is very dimly lit. Also, there is small path and steep-ish stairs that lead up to the yurt without railings. If you have an injury or are not sturdy on your feet please take caution before booking as there is a lot of uneven ground. Entering and exiting are at your own risk. The yurt is not an apartment or a hotel room - it's a yurt! please be aware of this when you book your stay. THERE IS NO KITCHEN OF ANY KIND, microwave, or fridge. We are so grateful to welcome you to share this space. Please enjoy your stay!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1560">
                       The yurt is the perfect getaway from reality.. Just a short walk from Sunset Junction, See what "Time Out" magazine has to say - Our LA city guide to Silver Lake reveals the best ways to enjoy this trendy Eastside 'hood, sometimes referred to as the Williamsburg of LA. Sure, Silver Lake's the butt of many a hipster joke, but we tend to mock what we envy most—and there's much to envy here. Silver Lake is one of LA's most walkable 'hoods, with (almost) everything conveniently located right on Sunset Boulevard. There are enough shops, bars and eateries to keep you consuming for days.                        <li data-reactid="1582"><p data-reactid="1583">All I can say is 'wow' what a beautiful space. The yurt was out of this world, tucked away in a gorgeous, garden; it was so aesthetically pleasing and wonderfully decorated. I particularly liked the balcony where you had a small view of LA and could see the Hollywood sign. The bathroom was just lovely and so pretty and we thoroughly enjoyed using it. Everything was easy to use and the instructions Amanda provided us helped us if not. I was also very pleased to find a yoga mat which I put to good use as I have been without one on my trip! The yurt was huge. It had a sofa, table and chairs, storage and a bed. Unfortunately we found the bed to be a bit small for two and rather uncomfortable (quite solid) which meant, sadly, our nights sleep there weren't that great. The location was fab, the yurt is located just off the main strip so we were so close to great cafes and restaurants and a short drive from everything else. However we where a bit disappointed that we didn't get to meet Amanda as she doesn't actually live at the property and as the yurts wifi wasn't available it was difficult to get in touch with her if we needed anything. We also felt being 'tourists' on holiday here (with no working phones) meant wifi is definitely something we needed especially if the host doesn't live at the same location. And also to use to plan our day and find the locations of things we needed (as no touristy info/guide was left about the city). All in all a nice experience, like five star +++ camping but without the practical facilities of a campsite/hotel.</p><span data-reactid="1584">Sophie &amp; </span><span data-reactid="1585">2015-08-20T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1586"><p data-reactid="1587">Walking into Amanda's yurt was like a breath of fresh air. From the lighting, furniture, wall decor, glass bottle of water, wine key and more, every little bit of space was created with care. The bed is incredibly comfortable, perfect for two and laid with just enough blankets for a chilly-ish California evening. There's also a small table for dining at inside the yurt, as well as one outside on the front porch. This porch is also great for morning yoga sessions beneath the trees and cacti, using the yoga mat Amanda provides! The outdoor shower is a dream, and well enclosed for a balance of privacy and openness. I love the inset tub, linen towels, and small candles throughout the bathroom (Amanda is sure to leave a lighter for this as well!). On top of the care put into the yurt, Amanda was also incredibly helpful and responsive throughout our stay. If you're looking for a magical getaway, book this place fast! </p><span data-reactid="1588">Ariela</span><span data-reactid="1589">2015-04-27T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1683">
                     <div data-reactid="1684">
                      <div data-reactid="1685">
                       Truly unique urban sanctuary in one of Los Angeles's premiere Mid-Century Buildings. Floor to glass windows with stunning south views of LA. Available for small production photo shoots or filming
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1686">
                       Polished floors with a mix of brand new contemporary and mid-century furniture. High-speed internet, cable and free long distance calls to over 40 countries including the EU. Over 1,400 sq ft of space with a zen modern vibe, Minimal kitchen and bathroom but full of supplies including Nespresso machine and Clarins shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. The loft is mostly quite but noise does travel easily in the building.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1687">
                       The building is next to MacArthur Park, central to Downtown Los Angeles, Koreatown, and Hollywood and proximal to Sliver Lake/Los Feliz. MacArthur Park is not yet gentrified so it's a colorful mix of people during the day and attracts a lot of transients at night. I am quite found of this but for visitors the building has a gated garage and security desk.
                      </div>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1814">
                     <div data-reactid="1815">
                      <div data-reactid="1816">
                       This beautiful home sits at the top of Echo Park! A beautiful sanctuary surrounded by trees, the home comfortably fits 4-6 (2 couples and a friend) and has panoramic views of downtown, mountains, and the ocean-on clear days!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1817">
                       Super quiet and peaceful home perched at the top of Echo Park hills, surrounded by trees, we are 1 block to the trails of elysian park, and 15 minutes walking to the doors of Dodger Stadium. Up the hill from Fix Coffee on Echo Park Ave. and only a 10 minute walk to Sunset blvd in the heart of Echo Park. There is a beautiful private patio that is attached to the living room which is very nice to have dinners and drinks on. There is a large front patio surrounded by plants, and a round day bed to sun bathe. The main bedroom gets the majority of the 180* view, and you can wake up feeling refreshed and in the trees with the birds. The Second Bedroom doubles as an office space with beautiful built shelves and funky mid-century furniture. The views are of the planet filled patio and there San Bernardino snow-capped mountains to the east. The mustard colored couch folds out into a full size double bed. We also have a queen size air mattress and day bed couch in the living room for a 5th or 6th guest.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1818">
                       It is so tranquil surrounded by trees, you feel like you are on a true nature vacation without the loud honking of busses and LA traffic. Yet, we are so close (walkable!) from the main area of Echo Park! Amazing restaurants, bars, etc...Echo Park is an amazing neighborhood! There are great restaurants, shops, and music venues everywhere! Echo Park lake is located just 15 minutes away, and the famous music venues The Echo and Echoplex are also just 15 minutes walk away! And yet, you get to explore the hidden gems of echo park that only locals know about located just minutes from the front door! These great gems include the cutest coffee shops restaurants, famous artist studios, vintage shops, etc! +if you like, I can email/leave a list of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, stores, and attractions in the area+
                      </div>

                      <!-- react-text: 1907 -->

                      <div data-reactid="1908">
                       Comfortable and stylish 1 bedroom, 1 bath, apartment in duplex, craftsman style building in the Echo Park area of Los Angeles. Classically restored with a modern flair, this duplex unit has hardwood floors throughout, bright ambiance, luxuriously comfortable bed (temperpedic mattress), cozy vintage furnishings, with a full kitchen and outdoor patio. Ideal accommodations for a pleasant stay in the Los Angeles area. Echo Park is one of the happening neighborhoods of LA, with a wide variety of excellent and interesting eateries, restaurants, music venues and bars. Silverlake and Downtown adjacent, with convenient access to the Los Angeles convention center, Hollywood, Universal City, Griffith Park (hiking, biking, running and golfing) as well as local access to Dodger stadium and Elysian Park. Many beach areas are within easy driving distance, including Venice and Santa Monica. Sunset Blvd. is 2 blocks away. Buses connect in all directions. Union station - downtown, (with metro-rail connections) is a 5 minute bus ride away. Sleeps up to 4 comfortably, with a queen bed in the bedroom and a full sofa-bed in the living room. Features include a private outdoor patio, front porch, laundry, internet with Wifi, cable TV, fireplace. Street parking is readily available. There is a security entry gate to the property. Please message me if you have any additional questions about the property or the surrounding Los Angeles area. We pride ourselves on helping to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
                      </div>
                      <!-- react-text: 1909 -->
                      <!-- /react-text -->
                      <div data-reactid="1910">
                       <li data-reactid="1911"><p data-reactid="1912">The place had a good location in a nice part of LA. Joanne was quick to respond to any messages which was really helpful as we had been waiting on replies from other host and we could not continue to wait any longer. It can be a little loud with older wood floors and the attached unit, but that comes with older homes I think. All in all I would not have any problem staying there again.</p><span data-reactid="1913">Matthew &amp; Yi</span><span data-reactid="1914">2015-07-07T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1915"><p data-reactid="1916">I never met Joanne but got a message on the day of arrival with instructions. The place is clearly not inhabited by anybody and totally lacks the warmth of an actual house. The place also lacks maintenance and even lacks a set of sheets for the sofa bed. Location is convenient and close to downtown, but as I mentioned before I cannot recommend this place.</p><span data-reactid="1917">Alejandro</span><span data-reactid="1918">2016-06-19T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1919"><p data-reactid="1920">It's a lovely place in Echo Park, well located in Los Angeles. As described by Joanne, there are nice restaurants and cafés in the neighborhood. Car parking in the street is really easy. The two apartments (we have rented both for a week) are very pleasant, quiet and well furnished. The only drawback (for foreigners) is the absence of a landline phone for receiving calls. We spent a very nice stay in these apartments and I highly recommend them for those who want to have an enjoyable stay in L.A. Kind regards, Lydie. April 2013.</p><span data-reactid="1921">Lydie</span><span data-reactid="1922">2013-04-15T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1923"><p data-reactid="1924">I lived in this place for 4 weeks. The photos are exactly what you will see and Echo park is beautiful. However, I faced some of problems: 1. You can hear every single movement or sound (even snoring) of your neighbor from the bedroom. I used ear plug. 2. The place smells bad, probably because of woods! However, it is almost clean. 3. You share the main gate with your neighbor and almost all of the nights my neighbor didn't close it. One day, a stranger entered the gate and knocked door and all windows very madly to see if I parked on his spot or not. I was terribly scared, because I didn't expect anyone to enter the gate. I called Joanne, she was nice in talking and tried to convince me that it was abnormal for me because of cultural difference!!! She promised to text me police number just to feel safe there, but it never happened. I could find it myself, but she could do that, then I could feel better about her hospitality. </p><span data-reactid="1925">Mansoureh</span><span data-reactid="1926">2015-11-01T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1927"><p data-reactid="1928">The place was great. Exactly what we were looking for. A beautiful kitchen, bedroom with lots of light, and a porch that got the most beautiful light at sunset. Great place to write! It's half a block from echo park and 2 blocks from sunset blvd which is perfect. Great place all around! Joanne was very responsive whenever I reached out. Will stay again!</p><span data-reactid="1929">Elena</span><span data-reactid="1930">2014-04-06T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                       <li data-reactid="1931"><p data-reactid="1932">A small group of us rented out both apartments for a weekend getaway. The apartments were great- clean, simple, and tastefully furnished. The location was convenient, street parking was plentiful, and the neighborhood felt safe. Checking in and checking out was easy and getting in contact with Joanne was never an issue. She was a terrific host. A couple of the guests complainied that the internet was a tad bit slow, but this was not a huge issue. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.</p><span data-reactid="1933">marissa</span><span data-reactid="1934">2013-08-06T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2033">
                     <div data-reactid="2034">
                      <div data-reactid="2035">
                       Newly remodeled turn of the century home near downtown LA in hip Echo Park neighborhood. Walk to everything and enjoy the great view of downtown from the private deck.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2036">
                       Great views of downtown from private deck. Upstairs is one room, bath and kitchen. Downstairs is completely private with its own entrance. Guest room, bath and laundry all located downstairs. Private deck, outdoor gas fireplace, BBQ grill and garden. Love the hipster/old LA vibe. Walk to everything - boutiques, taquerias, live music at the Echo Plex and so much more. Miles of parks/hikes all walkable from the house - Elysian Park - Dodger Stadium, Echo Park Lake. Right in the middle of the city, but seems like a quiet neighborhood on the hill. Several bus stops at the street. Union Station is only 2 miles away and metro is 2 miles as well. Pets are allowed with approval. The bones of the home are from the turn of the century, but I rebuilt it last year. It was a labor of love and this is truly a blessed home full of items from my travels around the world. Mi casa es sus casa, so please enjoy and love it as much as I do!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2037">
                       Great coffee down the street at Woodcat. Walk to Dodger games from the house. Fancy dining at Ostrich Farm. Live music at Echo Plex. Organic grocers at Cookbook and Lassen's ALL WALKABLE! No need for a car
                      </div>

                      <div data-reactid="2105">
                       Our cute 1-bedroom guest house-apartment has cool and charming ambiance with wooden floors &amp; solid wood furnishings. It's a 2-min walk to Echopark Lake, 2-min walk to Dodgers Stadium &amp; accessible to any public bus &amp; transportation 24-7. Strategically located up the hill overlooking Sunset Blvd &amp; Hollywood sign. Also, it's a block away from restaurants, bars, fronting groceries &amp; beer markets.                        <li data-reactid="2109"><p data-reactid="2110">Steven was a great host, always available and helpful. Upon arrival, Steven assisted us with bringing our bags up to the apartment which was really helpful considering the stairs going up the hill were steep. So if you have any physical mobility problems, this place isn't for you. Steven thought of everything from snacks/food, coffee, wine, etc. There were fresh flowers, toiletries, hair and premium skin products. The location was great as it's just around the corner from echo park where there was paddle boats and restaurant. Great variety of great restaurants and shopping. On Friday, there was a nice farmers market. Close to downtown. Nightlife was awesome and within walking distance! The only reason that I didn't give five stars is the mattress was very firm, uncomfortable for us and the shower didn't get hot but rather lukewarm. Other than that, we had a blast! </p><span data-reactid="2111">Jovon</span><span data-reactid="2112">2017-03-19T00:00:00Z</span></li>

The mattress was brand new and comfortable. The bathroom shower head and hot water galore for relaxing and any product you wished for available for guests. Steven was generous with fruit, chocolate, and coffee available at check in. Large smart TV, internet, and music all available. The space is larger than expected and very comfortable. The location could not be better. I expected more noise being right off of Sunset Blvd. but that was not the case. The complex is quiet and safe. Close to Hollywood, Dodger's Stadium, China Town. Tour bus pick up couple blocks away at the Super 8 and buses easily accessible right on Sunset. Hit Ostrich for brunch and El Compadre's flaming Rita's for dinner and Mariachi music. We would definitely stay at Stephen's Guest House again!</p><span data-reactid="2115">JEFFREY</span><span data-reactid="2116">2017-03-23T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2301">
                     <div data-reactid="2302">
                      <div data-reactid="2303">
                       Female friendly. Newly built Luxury Studio Apartment includes private entrance, cable TV, WiFi, Kitchenette (w/sink, fridge, hotplates, pots/pans, dishes, silverware etc). For those who demand 5 star luxury lifestyle living at affordable prices.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2304">
                       My wife Xochitl hosts with me so you may be dealing with either one of us. Our Designer studio apartment is extremely female friendly, it's how my wife likes it as she prefers female guests, but of course gentlemen are most welcome too. This new purpose built luxury studio apartment is designed to fit the requirements of the discerning modern traveler. Ideal for people in the design &amp; fashion industries or people who demand exceptional quality &amp; real comfort at affordable prices. The studio has a high end luxury queen size bed providing the most comfortable sleep, always fitted with fresh clean bedding &amp; clean towels for each new guest. The space is fully equipped with WiFi (which has been updated), 30" cable TV, a kitchenette with a double burner, fridge, kettle, toaster, pots &amp; pans, plates, bowls, cups, glasses &amp; silverware etc. It has all the comforts of being at home for those into designer &amp; quality lifestyles. We've designed our studio apartment with a Tulum Mexico Cabaña feel as we love Tulum, so the shower / restroom area is open rather than in a closed room. If you're coming as a couple &amp; either of you are shy about this feature, you may wish to reconsider booking. This is a no smoking studio apartment, but an ash tray is provided for smoking outside the studio door in our gorgeous landscape garden.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2305">
                       Set in the hills of Echo Park, this is easily the hippest area of Los Angeles &amp; has been compared in attitude to Williamsburg in Brooklyn &amp; Shoreditch in London only way quieter &amp; more spread out. Echo Park has it all &amp; could be described at it's neighbour Silverlake's cooler, younger sibling. The food in the area is amazing with many great restaurants of just about every cuisine. We're happy to recommend places to you. Please see our guidebook. There's also quality organic food supermarkets &amp; farmers markets in the area, which we're happy to direct you to. Once down the hills, Echo park is quite lively with lots of hip bars &amp; hang outs &amp; right next to Silverlake. We're always happy to point you in the right direction for a good night out.
                      </div>

recommendations.\n\nForbes Magazine has crowned Silver Lake the best hipster hood in the US. Silver Lake beat out 249 other neighborhoods including The Mission District, Williamsburg, Wicker Park in what we're sure is a thoroughly scientific survey of hipness. The criteria for neighborhoods were walkability, coffee shops per capita, local food truck selection and ratings, the number and frequency of farmers markets, the number of locally-owned bars and restaurants and residents who work in artistic occupations. \n\n- - - Here is Forbes Magazine's write up - - -\nAmerica's Hippest Hipster Neighborhoods \nSilver Lake, Los Angeles, Ca \n\"Want to roll out of bed and pick up a cup of single-origin java from a coffee shop on your corner? Or grab a gourmet grilled cheese sandwich from a food truck parked down the street? Does a dream weekend include foraging for organic veggies at a farmers market and watching the latest hot indie band play on a small stage through the wee hours of the morning? Then, my hipster friend, Los Angeles’ Silver Lake is the neighborhood for you.\n\nSilver Lake takes the top spot on Forbes’ inaugural list of America’s Best Hipster Neighborhoods. Nestled between Echo Park and Los Feliz, the trendy community boasts some of the nation’s most lauded food trucks and farmers markets, a multicultural blend of residents with eclectic professions, and a booming arts scene. Even the buildings exude an avant garde aesthetic a hipster could love: Silver Lake is home to some of the most celebrated modernist architecture in the country, including Richard Neutra’s VDL Research House and John Lautner’s Silvertop.\"","picture_url":"https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/82949995/c3fa09f0_original.jpg?aki_policy=large","property_type":"Apartment","public_address":"Los Angeles, CA, United States","seo_reviews":[{"reviewer_first_name":"Madeleine","comments":"Great communication, good location and neighbourhood, tidy apartment but a lot of traffic outside which made it quite noisy. recommendations.\n\nForbes Magazine has crowned Silver Lake the best hipster hood in the US. Silver Lake beat out 249 other neighborhoods including The Mission District, Williamsburg, Wicker Park in what we're sure is a thoroughly scientific survey of hipness. The criteria for neighborhoods were walkability, coffee shops per capita, local food truck selection and ratings, the number and frequency of farmers markets, the number of locally-owned bars and restaurants and residents who work in artistic occupations. \n\n- - - Here is Forbes Magazine's write up - - -\nAmerica's Hippest Hipster Neighborhoods \nSilver Lake, Los Angeles, Ca \n\"Want to roll out of bed and pick up a cup of single-origin java from a coffee shop on your corner? Or grab a gourmet grilled cheese sandwich from a food truck parked down the street? Does a dream weekend include foraging for organic veggies at a farmers market and watching the latest hot indie band play on a small stage through the wee hours of the morning? Then, my hipster friend, Los Angeles’ Silver Lake is the neighborhood for you.\n\nSilver Lake takes the top spot on Forbes’ inaugural list of America’s Best Hipster Neighborhoods. Nestled between Echo Park and Los Feliz, the trendy community boasts some of the nation’s most lauded food trucks and farmers markets, a multicultural blend of residents with eclectic professions, and a booming arts scene. Even the buildings exude an avant garde aesthetic a hipster could love: Silver Lake is home to some of the most celebrated modernist architecture in the country, including Richard Neutra’s VDL Research House and John Lautner’s Silvertop.\"","picture_url":"https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/82949995/c3fa09f0_original.jpg?aki_policy=large","property_type":"Apartment","public_address":"Los Angeles, CA, United States","seo_reviews":[{"reviewer_first_name":"Madeleine","comments":"Great communication, good location and neighbourhood, tidy apartment but a lot of traffic outside which made it quite noisy. Just a short walk from Sunset Junction, See what \"Time Out\" magazine has to say - Our LA city guide to Silver Lake reveals the best ways to enjoy this trendy Eastside 'hood, sometimes referred to as the Williamsburg of LA. Sure, Silver Lake's the butt of many a hipster joke, but we tend to mock what we envy most—and there's much to envy here. Silver Lake is one of LA's most walkable 'hoods, with (almost) everything conveniently located right on Sunset Boulevard. There are enough shops, bars and eateries to keep you consuming for days. The area has also managed to marry the shiny and new (of which there's a lot) with the shabby and old, making the neighborhood feel very, well, real. And it's totally bikeable: A Sunset Boulevard bike lane runs the length of the neighborhood and the sidewalks here have more racks than parking meters. Whether you explore Silver Lake on two wheels or two feet, you'll find the best of what this Eastside nabe has to offer—and meet some friendly folks along the way. for them?&quot;,&quot;community_commitment.tell_prospective_guests_about_your_listing_accessibility&quot;:&quot;In many cases, Airbnb hosts are not required to make their homes compliant with the standards set out in the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) . However, you can’t decline a guest based on any actual or perceived disability. You should do your best to provide accurate information about your home’s accessibility features (or lack of them), allowing for guests with disabilities to decide for themselves whether the home is appropriate to their individual needs.&quot;,&quot;community_commitment.what_if_i_change_my_mind_after_declining_the_commitment?&quot;:&quot;What if I change my mind after declining?&quot;,&quot;community_commitment.we_will_send_you_info_about_how_to_reinstate_your_account&quot;:&quot;Once your account has been canceled, we’ll send you information about how to reinstate it if you change your mind.
